LanguageData.Button_Backup_Tooltip: Backup the current mod list into the selected slot.
LanguageData.Button_Import_Tooltip: Import a mod list from a save game.
LanguageData.Button_Restore_Tooltip: Restore the mod list from the selected slot.
LanguageData.Button_State_Select_Tooltip: Select a slot to Backup/Restore into.\n* means the slot has not been set.
LanguageData.ConfirmUninstall: Are you sure you wish to uninstall {0}?
LanguageData.Dialog_Import_Desc: Select a save to load mods from. This will load it directly into RimWorld and overwrite what mods are currently selected. You can then backup the mod list into a slot.
LanguageData.IncompatibleVersion: This mod is for a different RimWorld version.
LanguageData.InstallModDesc: Select a name to identify the new installation of {0}\n\nNOTE:Some mods may experience issues if they are renamed.
LanguageData.Name: Name
LanguageData.NameLengthLimit: Name must be less than {0} characters
LanguageData.Settings_State_Names_Desc: You can name each save state here.\n* means the slot has not been set.
LanguageData.Settings_State_Revert_Desc: This will restore the mods backup that is created everytime RimWorld starts. Use this if something goes wrong and you lose your mod order\n\nNOTE:You must restart RimWorld for the new mods list to take effect.
LanguageData.Settings_Steam_Sync_Desc: Sync your mod save states to Steam's cloud. It is recommended to close Rimworld and allow Steam to sync after changing this setting.
LanguageData.ToolsTabDescription:
These are common and not so common tools for Mod List Backup all in one handy place. If you can't find a feature/function elsewhere then it should be here.
All tools will ask for confirmation or show another dialog before taking any action.
Hover over each button for more details on that feature.
LanguageData.DeleteAllBackupsDialog: Are you sure you want to delete all {0} backups?\n\nWARNING:This Cannot be undone.
